title: We're getting Blood Moon skins next patch and honestly, I'm a bit disappointed.

embed.description: Legends of Runeterra 0.8.3 notes + Previews of new Guardians Basilisk, Silverwing, & Gloomtooth / Clash coming Feb 22-23] A new PBE preview is now out on Riot social media, showing off new Blood Moon skins for Katarina, Master Yi, and Tryndamere! Continue reading for a closer look!

body:
Blood Moon I feel is one of the more interesting skin lines Riot has made so it's nice to still see it going, but at the same time I'm a bit disappointed in who they chose this time.

{{champion:55}} I think is fine. She fits in the theme well, the skin itself I think is pretty good, and the effects look nice. It's {{champion:23}}  & {{champion:11}} that I take issue with. Both skins just don't really feel that inspiring, at least to me. 

Yi without his mask looks like a damn troll doll. and even with the mask he still looks dumb. The effects feel average, but considering on how linear he is I can't really blame that too much (I mean, how much further can they go to really make his animations/VFXs look amazing without turning him into legendary or unrecognizable?). 

Tryndamere on the other hand I'm just wondering why they chose him. I mean...it's **Tryndamere**. One of the oldest champs in the game who's animations, visuals and VO are heavily outdated (not to mention that he's picked up attention a few times on the boards in the month about being stupid to play against). I honestly would of figured they would keep him on the sidelines until they got around to updating him to give him something better. This is kind of a scenario of where he's getting a new skin despite his age and issues, like Fiddlesticks, but because of his age and issues, the new skin just doesn't look that great, like Udyr or Lee. I mean, all of his skins, except Sultan if I recall, have janky animations. I know the preview is short but I guarantee if you compare it with his other skins, it'll feel like the same quality as the rest due to how he is animated.

Idk, those are just my quick thoughts. I do like the Katarina skin (even though I don't play her) but the other two just feel lackluster. I would of loved to see something else like (if they didn't already get skins this year) Blood Moon {{champion:107}} or {{champion:48}}. Hell you could of tried throwing in {{champion:238}} and see how he would look in the skinline if you really wanted. Maybe you guys like them, maybe you're with me. Again, just my thoughts on the subject.

replies.body:
Like, I know this is a troll and everything but I'm just curious how a post saying "I dislike this piece of content and think it would be better suited to someone else" equates to "liberal rainbow offended trash."

{{sticker:sg-lux-2}}
Don't get sucked in by it, he's projecting.

>
> LOL, I cant believe this is an actual post, holy shit this community is liberal rainbow offended trash. Who gives a fk? If you don't like it don't buy it.

That is quite a bit disrespectful. Please do not hurl insults, especially considering you insulted the entire Boards community. Also political talk is not accepted here. Furthermore, not liking skin designs or champ choices because it is lack luster or bad does not equate being trash.
Blood Moon Syndra wouldve been dope af ;_; She hasnt been getting any love from Rito

I thought blood moon was supposed to be assassins and assassins like champions. Yasuo was pushing it but tryn wtf whyyyyy he doesn't fit at all.

Edit: I'm stupid and don't pay attention to skin lines apparently my bad. But that doesn't change the fact I think tryn was a stupid choice.

Wait wtf. I completely missed those. Wow that is fucking stupid. I get shen since he is a ninja but the rest wtf.

Man that skin line really went downhill.

The entire line, as of 2020 is now:

Blood Moon Aatrox,  Blood Moon Aatrox Prestige Edition, Blood Moon Akali,  Blood Moon Diana, Blood Moon Elise,  Blood Moon Evelynn, Blood Moon Jhin,  Blood Moon Kalista, Blood Moon Katarina,  Blood Moon Kennen, Blood Moon Master Yi, Blood Moon Pyke, Blood Moon Sivir,  Blood Moon Talon, Blood Moon Thresh, Blood Moon Tryndamere, Blood Moon Twisted Fate,  Blood Moon Yasuo, Blood Moon Zilean

And yeah, a lot of them are not Assassins... so.

It may have started off with Akali and Shen, an Assassin and a Warden, then moved on towards Kalista, Elise and Thresh (Marksmen, Diver and Catcher) then got some assassins, mage, marksmen, ect.  So it's always had a fairly diverse set of characters (not just one type really)

Dude, you're confusing the Bloodmoon skinline with the Bloodmoon gamemode.

The skinline was NEVER assassin only. It started with bloody SHEN.

The gamemode is Assassin only though.

The skin line was never reserved for assassins lmao.

Don't forget Sivir, Kalista, Thresh, TF, Jhin... XD

I dunno what world anyone could think they were Assassins or assassin-like

Originally it was supposed to be a lore skin about a play. Then it became an Ionian interpretation of the shadow isles. Then it became a cult. Iâ€™m not sure why people believed it was reserved for assassins.

Yeah, it started off that way with the Shen and Akali skins, back in the Journal of Justice days.  Then kind of moved on to how people would tell stories of characters across the lands and that's where Kalista's came from.  Then it moved into the Demon Cult when they had Diana, Aatrox, and the more recent ones come out.
The misconception might've arosed with Blood Moon Mode where only assasin-like or aggresive champions were allowed. Even that already had champions whose inclusion was questionable.
Have you tried assassin shen...totally an assassin. Just r in, insta kill someone and dash out right?

Could not agree more about the yi skin. His maskless face is..... disappointing (unlike zed's), and his meditation green + red just looks half-assed and weird. Plus yi already has enough skins, they should've just released one for a champ with less skins. I mean, blood moon syndra, azir or taliyah would have been great. 

Also agreed about trynd. He fits the theme, but the champ itself should be getting an update soon. If it has to be a top laner, give it to illaoi, fiora, or heck even sett would be nice.

> [{quoted}](name=XD haha,realm=OCE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=bplp3kHs,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2020-02-04T21:23:14.290+0000)
>
> his meditation green + red just looks half-assed and weird.

YES! I completely missed that.

While I do think the green with all the red looks weird (I had the same issue with Nightbringer Soraka), the skins team didn't really have much of a choice in that regard. Heal effects *have* to be green for gameplay clarity.
Yeah, I mean Yi already had a much better fully unmasked skin in Eternal Sword.

Katarina looks great. Yi again> Yi has a billion skins. Yes I know that Riot needs to make popular champs have skins, but do the same overused champs need to be in EVERY skin patch? IMHO once a champ gets a skin, wait at least 6 months before giving another. I am sick of Kaisa, Jinx, Lux, Ahri, Yi, Xayah, and of course Akali. Ez isn't bad as he has not received too many skins compared to these others. But seriously....

Then there is Tryndamere. Once again WHY are they picking outdated champs with awful animations for the good skins, when there are modern/vgud champs who fit those skins just as well and actually have non cardboard visuals and animations. So yeah this year Bloodmoon is dissappointing. It is like all the major skin lines have failed this year. First Xmas, then Lunar, now Blood Moon. At least we have previous BM skins which were awesome. Katarina looks great as I said.

Why should a champion's age have any limitation on what skinline they're available for? Saying that people need to have 'non-cardboard' animations for the "Good" skin lines sounds more like you'd rather them being stuck with conversly shittier skinlines just because of something the champion themselves has no control over.

> [{quoted}](name=Academy Kayn,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=bplp3kHs,comment-id=000a0000,timestamp=2020-02-05T07:03:17.384+0000)
>
> Why should a champion's age have any limitation on what skinline they're available for? Saying that people need to have 'non-cardboard' animations for the "Good" skin lines sounds more like you'd rather them being stuck with conversly shittier skinlines just because of something the champion themselves has no control over.

Well because if their visuals are outdated, it makes the skin look bad. I'd rather champs like Trynd not get skins until they are updated to where the skins will look good. But if you give skins to a bad looking champ, the skin will not be high quality.

I mean, you're not wrong that the animations aren't good, but I don't think that's a good reason to just not give old Champions any skins whatsoever. Tryndamere is not high on the list of VGUs currently, so he's most likely not going to get one soon until Champions that are higher on the list get one. I would much rather he get a new skin to tide his fans over then just giving him nothing for years until an update.

Feel the same, Bloodmoon has so much potential for great animations that it is really a shame they have picked Master Yi and Tryndamere here, since these 2 almost have no animations to show off in this skin line.

My personal favourite for the skin line would be Camille, there is a fan concept for it and I wish Riot would do something similar:
https://i.pinimg.com/originals/bf/44/5d/bf445d0dedd5d61150b06c1c62342857.jpg
Like, come on, it's **amazing**!!!!
Agree. Definitely felt rushed to me at least.

I completely agree. The masks Trynd and Yi have and the hair make them look almost the exact same except Trynd has darker hair and the weapons don't even feel blood moon too me maybe its just the design but they look really weird. Kat doesn't look impressive or particularly interesting and the fact that Riot gave her the ever so classical "Im a girl champ so I wont wear my mask fully despite that being one of the main things about the skin line and instead I will put my mask on the side of my head and only ever use it when I recall because people need to see my face" trope leaves these skins feeling boring. I don't like asian themed skins usually because I feel like theres way too much in league but blood moon is one I always found because I like demonic stuff but Riot is really failing people who actually really like blood moon with these champ choices and the way they just mess up a easy choice/design

Blood Moon {{champion:203}} has basically been the most requested skin for them since their release.

Hell, even Blood Moon {{champion:103}} would have been a better choice than Yi and Trynd (Yes, she gets a LOT of skins, but most of her playerbase seems to really just want a dark/edgy skin and Pool Party and we really aren't sure why Riot will give her every skin except those)
Agreed with both, especially with Ahri. Yeah, she already is popular and she has a lot of skins but the blood moon skin REALLY fits her. She is a KITSUNE for crying out loud!{{champion:103}}
riots being really lazy this year thus far with skins and its pissing me off.

I mean, it's only been one month in and this so far is my only complaint about skins so far. Mecha Kingdoms was meh, Dragonslayers looked pretty neat, and Guardian of the Sands was...meh again (i don't play though champs either). 

It's mostly the choices of champs here and their overall designs that I'm having to say are just really missing the mark so far. Hopefully they'll get the message and make improvements throughout the year.
Marty McFly: "You may not be ready for Bloodmoon skins... but the weebs are gonna love it."

To be honest I actually like the Tryndamere skin the most, simply because it looks the most unique out of these 3.
I mean we already have another Bloodmoon Swordsman with Yasuo and a different demonic assassin with Evelynn.

But Tryndamere is a hulking brute who actually looks like he is posessed by the demon in his mask and we don't really have that in the bloodmoon skins yet(the closest thing to that would be Aatrox, but he is too refined to give the same feeling).
I really like all three.
And no one can take that away from you.
Instead of Yi/Tryndamere, they could've done like, {{champion:55}} , {{champion:112}}  and {{champion:203}} . Where is my Kindred skin, this would've perfect for heeeeer!
It is a shame that Kindred didn't get Bloodmoon.

Remember when bloodmoon was only about a clut following of demons, death, magic, and mask?
Yeah neither does Riot.
I mean, you're forgetting that it's also about a Bloodmoon *Cult*, not just demons and magic.
